7EDF8B0B24644D24B5EAB9126E7FB7EB.description: The student will pray for openness and generous response to God's call in their lives.

069BDC3982AE4099ABC886431B9A3A94.description: The student will demonstrate appropriate reverence during prayer

C9C58C1D0ABC44949EC905E498E709A3.description: The student will demonstrate appropriate reverence during prayer

9F93EF0A04C64AA58C35DDA418EEB281.description: The student will demonstrate the use of different types of prayer

E6DB941992E643C2A799D75EB70126CD.description: The student will participate in meditative prayer.

C6386660B7C74708A33E02D85985F559.description: The student will discuss and/or participate in Eucharistic devotions such as Adoration, Forty Hours, and Benediction.

C06C18CA5A284195B88E333404DAED0B.description: The student will locate the "Hear O Israel" prayer in Deuteronomy Chapter 6 and identify it as the Hebrew Creed. Describe how it is used in worship and daily life.

D0648117FFAC4DA18C191304ED1200B6.description: The student will discuss the role of persistence in prayer to overcome difficulties.

69DBDBCBD2E84228803CBEF6AC66271B.description: The student will participate in traditional Marian devotions

0078B4C27DAE49A09D5E59E1DC38F67D.description: The student will pray the psalms.

D3F805AB0C5B45CDB2BD3A5E3F65A6A9.description: The student will identify some places where the Catholic Church uses the psalms (at Mass, in the Liturgy of the Hours, etc.)

3A50165D43BD42FAAA80F495A0E027C9.description: The student will compose personal prayers based on the model of Old Testament prayers.

D0E58ECFC0124C45BD103182AF8A99AE.description: The student will list the categories of Psalms

2AF0D14905CC45B191C5048DC7B5D9AA.description: The student will identify the Psalms as a collection of hymns or poetry collected over several centuries and used as the public prayer of the Church (CCC 2585 ff).

347F32E0057E48A98D76A1534A0CA258.description: The student will recite common prayers of the Catholic Church (See Appendix).

8E4791A5A82D4CA98BC174856518A2B4.description: The student will help design, organize, and/or participate in a student-direct service project.

5C0A1C24400C4F6E8DA62F5A61C92EA8.description: The student will tell about the lives of some modern day witnesses and their service to society.

A2B28BB52B7745B4A55B7859D9A69690.description: The student will identify the Old Testament ideas of tithing and Jubilee debt forgiveness (i.e., Leviticus 25:8-22)

D4A3A20C5E3D48949BFE86B617D4BB61.description: The student will study the leadership roles of the Old Testament prophets including their attitude toward the poor, the disadvantaged, immigrants, and the needs of the community.

E82741C7C90348CAA8E67EAC2CA4BCB1.description: The student will define God's call to leadership as a call to service for the community.

CB085599D9DA48AAB195863A3AE6F370.description: The student will identify that the Ten Commandments reflect the natural law.

DEC074C2CF214029B4DBCB940061AD40.description: The student will analyze each of the Commandments and relate it to their personal relationship with God and each other.

2AFBFC7D0A334E07AE3834985F974E01.description: The student will identify the Ten Commandments as the moral guideline for God's people.

3EFDF8C1F6F84518A109D4988BA269F9.description: The student will memorize the Ten Commandments.

3DD8445FB018450A9F222D42C3FA71EE.description: The student will describe how each vocation builds up the community.

470B707E43984BEFA45E34993B270D63.description: The student will explain vocations as a call t othe single, married, religious, or ordained life.

39F5A7EE931F4B61919E2CF364221D8D.description: The student will demonstrate the skill of listening - to hear others respectfully, and to be open to the voice of God

18349A17F564430D9679649655B3EE87.description: The student will identify ways that God called individuals in the Old Testament to serve in the community and formulate examples of ways that God continues to call us to serve in the community today.

DE7D5F7988B041A982D7DBFEC88B57F8.description: The student will demonstrate responsibility for choices and their consequences for the community.

979A2F6926C0474EABE0691386D04DF5.description: The student will review the 10 principles of social justice.

06C04208A59B4D2E8CC661731B0CA88B.description: The student will recognize the family as a source of spiritual values, religious practices, customs, and traditions that help shape one physically, psychologically, and socially.

A3041439B9014AAD9AFFE22BAB4F2A43.description: The student will recognize the diversity of cultures, traditions, talents, and gifts.

98702A6214F94B17A1C23DF4B33111BD.description: The student will identify the marital act as unitive and procreative.

CA9BF5F967C44486B69B15ECCE6C7C7B.description: The student will discuss practices that protect the beautiful gift of chastity including: appropriate modest dress, language, prayer, sacraments and devotion to Mary.

5BA34506E6D54393AD9B8DFE46F0E0E5.description: The student will discuss chastity as a gift from God that is protected by His grace

6700655190A14E68A192187DACBFE65C.description: The student will evaluate contemporary lifestyles and identify those that undermine the value of life.

C62271D0A47D4F9C8822DA4F90B5F5B8.description: The student will discuss touching safety.

A88A4D9A477D4529B0F9A83338403237.description: The student will discuss changes that occur during puberty and their effect on relationships.

B77A682E9C9D43799E215BF364E11FB1.description: The student will discuss the effects of excluding, ignoring, and manipulating others.

71DE64317F924F2F83F6150C54E5F3CB.description: The student will define and discuss the purpose of "dating" for the discernment of a future spouse.

66F09230B78A47AA9AEBCDC01C7B406B.description: The student will discuss the value of friendships.

2ADF64EC9B3145A6B1A10B5A9F70A3AE.description: The student will discuss the negative consequences of inappropriate displays of affection

3A4F2BD42FBD4B61AAA17F38B7339DFB.description: The student will discuss appropriate ways to show affection for classmates and peers.

37F798BABC04457EABFBBFDB7866D3FB.description: The student will give special consideration to the 6th and 9th commandments and how they apply to young people.

29518C725CBB4560B54DE8DCC98C8A4A.description: The student will discuss sexuality as a gift from God.

F21B35A5BF3F420397C3914221054240.description: The student will compare Old Testament families and how their actions affect their relationships, with events and relationships in today's families.

B490F78849714D8299378EF121E602EC.description: The student will compare the covenant of marriage to the Old Testament covenants.

9B5DFB037B564E779C65CA38F1568123.description: The student will define and discuss that the covenant of marriage is rooted in the original unity of the creation of Adam and Eve.

FCC5E54F2B9B4DDC898513FFBA934729.description: The student will define friendship as a gift of self in imitation of Christ that leads others to a greater good (CCC 2347).

EFA9672ACC2C493D8C9890444EFC02B6.description: The student will discuss and apply guidelines for choosing movies, TV programs, music, books, magazines, video games, etc. that are supportive of human dignity.

D22DB4EBF9944C5F9E9353ED2509E165.description: The student will identify some school situations where individuals or groups are persecuted.

BB2373CE437F4772943474D535EE2E69.description: The student will identify some other groups or persons that have been persecuted and indicate why.

8E204022FFDD4A5AA4333B5C9ED34D53.description: The student will point out some of the persecutions endured by the Jewish people in the Old Testament, throughout history, and into modern time.

DCCA2ED668414196BF3D621785A5ED11.description: The student will defend the idea of human dignity based on the creation and covenant passages of the Old Testament.

1059AEB7BB3F4B2DBAD12EEFE0239848.description: The student will discuss the source of human dignity as our being created in the image and likeness of God

1DD99D497CDA4086935FF6351FC3B347.description: The student will describe some sacramental actions of the Church that originated in Jewish rituals.

64C28D5BC748491DB280F183EB124B27.description: The student will give some examples of Old Testament events that prefigure the sacraments.

9A1B756E5043428A87B66051564F60A1.description: The student will participate regularly in the Sacraments of Eucharist and Reconciliation

1630021DD89048899E4DBBA1272DDBD0.description: The student will celebrate Easter as a liturgical season that commemorates the Resurrection of Christ from the dead.

353156DF5DEB411FB6B524BA802DB477.description: The student will discuss the signs, symbols, and events of the Easter Triduum

536EB909BF9F49B69843D0BD42623B60.description: The student will celebrate Lent as a liturgical season of repentance and renewal. Identify some traditions/practices used by the Old Testament people and early Christian communities and relate them to modern day observances and regulations.

4A889DA54EC44B09AB95B0071764487A.description: The student will celebrate Christmas as the liturgical season that fulfills the Old Testament promise of the coming of the Messiah.

E69062DA85B34E78BB405FA69CA21506.description: The student will celebrate Advent as a liturgical season of waiting and preparation for the coming of the Messiah in history, in our daily lives, and at the end of the world.

8CB5D25635E64E82947FCD959BD0D437.description: Strand II: Celebration of the Christian Mystery

981F1417B6BD4D72A44294A0EE8CA9BB.description: The student will define tradition as the living transmission of the Word of God handed on from generation to generation through the apostolic succession in the Church.

AA2AB6AB47A64A3184A87B8CBE03F155.description: The student will define Scripture and Tradition as the one common source of Revelation, they are two distinct modes of transmission of Revelation.

3A2419ECE70D42CD8FFD00A5ED0ED0FF.description: The student will define an angel as "a spiritual, personal, and immortal creature, with intelligence and free will, who glorifies God without ceasing and who serves God as a messenger of his saving plan." (CCC glossary p. 866).

0BD5B69947684C5C9E690ABBA9887D09.description: The student will identify God the Father as the creator, Jesus as the Messiah and fulfillment of the Old Testament and the Holy Spirit as the inspiration of Sacred Scripture, the breath of life, and fire of love.

FDB13F0B89DB45DA8FDB63982EE3EEEA.description: The student will explore the Jewish roots of our Christian faith, for example: Sacrifice, Priesthood (Tribe of Levi), Melchizedek, Passover, Suffering Servant (Isaiah), Lamb of God.

15833360C61D4DC0895D3446D29F4AA9.description: The student will identify how specific events of the Old Testament foreshadow Christ

93A37A46CC334D97B367DAB1D4EF691E.description: The student will retell narratives about important figures in the Old Testament such as patriarchs, judges, kings, and prophets in the context of salvation history.

8A2E409EF32D41D5B91F00EFFBE4C7D5.description: The student will define salvation history as God's unfolding work of salvation in all of history

C7494E0943084926ACDCFF3720E23CAE.description: The student will discuss the role of the creation narrative and Adam and Eve in salvation history.

1C2AA853658D46128812BDFB9CA1F1E5.description: The student will discuss how Jesus fulfills the Old Covenant and establishes the New and Eternal Covenant.

DB60CA12D0CA45C59D765DD6CD748FE6.description: The student will give examples of Old Testament covenant relationships: Adam and Eve, Noah, Abraham and his descendants, Moses, David Jeremiah.

368DE2A963FD4C1AB7947B6264671EAA.description: The student will define "covenant" and "testament" as synonymous.

319338CA110B4298972A73372DCE8893.description: The student will define covenant as a "solemn agreement between human beings or between God and a human being involving mutual commitments or guarantees" (CCC Glossary p. 873).

2ABFD5066F304BEAA6BBB35DDE9FE2F9.description: The student will group the books of the Old Testament under the correct categories: Law, History, Wisdom, Prophets.

93C0782C0F1E4B71823C0D9D83A7DBF8.description: The student will list from memory the first five books of the Old Testament.

ED8C89BB26114F52A39CE6797338DECA.description: The student will identify that the Pentateuch is the first five books of the Old Testament.

53C4ED687054415CB59B0996B23C563E.description: The student will identify that there are 27 books in the New Testament.

529EA425A42A4AB980C42C10BDC41C1D.description: The student will identify that there are 46 books in the Old Testament .

F5D1DB88AA2C45478039DBD45FF60BAD.description: The student will discuss that "God is the author of Sacred Scripture because he inspired its human authors" (CCC 136) .

A434F037899C457BBCCCC033F54B0BCE.description: The student will discuss the Bible as a collection of books, inspired by the Holy Spirit and written by various authors, defined by the Catholic church by the late 4th century.

A42B45EC049941A0B0DD29BDA1AC7EB0.description: The student will identify sacred scripture as the speech of God as it is put down in writing under the breath of the Holy Spirit (CCC 81).
